website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight and easy to use. This mattock offers maximum comfort and a quality grip. Extremely affordable for the quality you get.
pros: We love the anti-vibration handle that's ideal when using this mattock for long periods
SureGrip rubber grip is comfortable to hold
Steel forged head is hard-wearing and durable
High digging efficiency provided by the integrated fin feature
cons: May be too lightweight for certain jobs

customer_reviews.title: Great for digging in rocky soil
customer_reviews.text: My yard is composed of clay and rock. Forget using a shove for digging. I usually dig with a pick axe but recently needed a smaller similar tool and opted for the HART 1.5 Lb. mini mattock for expanding a flower bed. The photo shows a rock I dug out using only the mini mattock and a pinch bar. I used the mattock to dig and clear all the smaller debris from around the larger rock and the pinch bar for prying it out. Great digging tool.
customer_reviews.author: Mackerel Bob

customer_reviews.title: Versatile tool
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tool ever! I had to dig holes for planting around a tree, and the ground was laced with roots up to one inch in diameter. The wedged end of this mattock went through the roots like butter. The sharpened pointed end let me get dirt out from between larger roots so I had plenty of room for my hostas. I chose the mattock with a 1 1/2 pound head because I knew it would be strong and heavy enough to get the job done, but it would not be so heavy that it would tire me out or injure my hand. I’d buy this again in a heartbeat - quality construction at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: MaryB

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality and durable.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to tunnel 12 feet under my house in order to reach buried plumbing. It performed flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Zani

customer_reviews.title: A superlative yard tool, excellent design and well made using quality steel
customer_reviews.text: This is a "have now owned for 6 months" review. I read the one critical review where the purchaser compared it with an Estwing hammer; that's a good analogy since Hart's quality is comparable to Estwing's which makes premium hammers. This hand held mattock has become one of my favorite yard and garden tools; I use it for planting new flowering bushes plus spring and summer flowering bulbs and have recently been using it to dig trenches in the yard, to form and pour concrete mowing strips. A superlative tool; well made, good balance and weight. I wholeheartedly recommend this tool for digging small to medium holes and areas.
customer_reviews.author: PCS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent in every respect
customer_reviews.text: I never regret spending appropriate money for a good tool. Tools are worth investing in and this is a quality Made in USA tool with great design, balance, weight, grip, etc. Most people will appreciate the weight which helps do the work, but those with old and/or arthritic hands may need something a bit lighter if they have a lot of work to do with this mattock.
customer_reviews.author: realkaren

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty real tool for real work
customer_reviews.text: Having tried several of these mattock type tools in the past few weeks, we can say this is one of the sturdiest and best for the money we've found. Only had it a day and if things change, I'll post an update but so far...highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: A J Berke

customer_reviews.title: Extremely durable.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best you will find for the price, extremely durable. I pry up large rocks with this and chip away conglomeration bead rock whilst still being able carry it on my belt when hiking. I originally ordered this intending on only using it while I looked for a better one, after using it for a few months I realized I forgot to look for a better one, I guess that makes this one good.
customer_reviews.author: RunsWithScissors

customer_reviews.title: to heavy for my needs
customer_reviews.text: It was to heavy as with other products like this brands hammers, I would of never bought if I had just picked it up once, it is kind of like a east wing hammer it feels very heavy does not feel right I ordered a lighter mini axe or mattlock on amazon that I love it and it has a yellow handle. I have bought about 10 different mini pick axes this year trying to find the right one to dig up kudzu roots.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Super Chopper
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item based on other reviews and I find it absolutely great. I have been using it to dig out small stumps about 4" in diameter. I can sit on my stool and dig around to slice through the roots in one or two chops versus using a shovel. It fits well in my hand, has good heft and a comfortable grip. The construction is all one piece so there's no worry about the head flying off. Excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jane M. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I live in an area where the "soil" is nothing but packed red clay and rocks. I needed something to loosen the ground that was not as large or heavy as a traditional pick axe. This mini mattock fits the bill. It is well balanced and cuts through the clay with ease. It is also easily pries the rocks out. Great garden tool.
customer_reviews.author: J. Neal

customer_reviews.title: Best Mattock I Have Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really built well. Very keen edge and point, balance is also great. I don’t know why it’s so hard to find a top-shelf small mattock locally (Lowes, Homedepot, Ace all seem to stock half-assed versions). They’re incredibly useful tools. Worth the price and then some.
customer_reviews.author: FILO

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty one hand mattock
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this tool. For some garden jobs that I used to use a full-size and heavy mattock for, I now use this tool. It is a lot easier to carry around and more precise in its digging. It seems to be very well made and I bet it will outlast me. It is not razor sharp but with its weight and a good swing it'll cut through many roots and it handles our clay soil well.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph F.

customer_reviews.title: My Husband Loved His Surprise
customer_reviews.text: My husband was looking for a digging tool to remove young trees that went unnoticed in a few of our flowering shrubs without harming the shrubs. A pick axe was too big and unwieldy for the job. I found this tool and it looked like the perfect tool for the job and it had very good ratings so I decided to buy it to surprise my husband. He loved his surprise! It was very well made and of very good quality. I would recommend this tool without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Archaeologist uses to clear rocky debris around historic foundations and features.
customer_reviews.text: Professional archaeologist my crews have used this tool to dig along building foundations and clear the rocky areas of builders TrEnches that would put to much wear on our typical archaeology picks (made to delicicately move soil). Pick the right tool for the right job. It has had very little wear and no damage from digging at a half dozen excavations. I would recommend this for clearing heavy clayish and/or rocky soils.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Wicked sharp and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love the high quality construction of this small mattock tool. Its easy to penetrate hard Texas soil and dig out rocks and also makes a fine defensive weapon instead of owning a gun. The sharp point end is wicked sharp as it the flat pick. I feel confident that this tool will outlive me.
customer_reviews.author: happykat

customer_reviews.title: There arw cheaper options, but i like this one.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I love the grip. I love the weight. I love the head design. I love the color combo. I use mine for excavating dinosaur fossils because noooobody wants to swing a five pound mattock all day.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Used for digging in glacial till and worked great

customer_reviews.title: Not bad

customer_reviews.title: Great gardening tool
customer_reviews.text: Solid enough to break up hard packed clayey soil areas and prepare them to be flower beds. This is a must sturdier tool than anything the big box hardware stores or garden centers near me were offering. Great for people who do not have the strength to swing a full size pick-axe. Pick end allows you to break up more earth near an existing plant, while retaining more of the root system, before using a spade for a transplant job.
